  • Constructor Details

    • TrafficSimulator_EditorController

      public TrafficSimulator_EditorController(TrafficSimulator_Editor view)
      Constructor for the Controller of the Environment Editor feature It accepts an instance of the editor scene and initializes all the necessary fields and methods Such as attaching the event handlers to each of the controls of the Editor View components
      Parameters:
      view - An instance of the TrafficSimulator_Editor scene

  • Method Details

    • handleKeyPress

      public void handleKeyPress() throws UnsupportedAudioFileException, IOException
      This event handler handles the events set by the previous scene's controller; the TrafficSimulatorController. The events are key presses. handleKeyPress() handles rotation, so if the R key is pressed on the keyboard. It will play the rotation sound (or won't, if sounds are muted), modifies the displayed rotation degrees label in the BottomPane and switches the currentPieceSelected URI (that is the selected piece) to its rotated variant based on the degrees. This is further reflected by re-setting the icon in the BottomPane, that displays to the user what the rotated piece looks like.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedAudioFileException - If the audio file is not supported, throw this exception.
      IOException - If the audio file is missing, throw this exception.

    • handleKeyPressInvertLanes

      public void handleKeyPressInvertLanes() throws UnsupportedAudioFileException, IOException
      This event handler attaches to the key press event set by the previous scene's controller: TrafficSimulatorController. If the V key is pressed on the keyboard, it will flip the lanes of the turn pieces. (NB: this feature only works on the TURN LEFT piece) It modifies the currentPieceSelected string, which holds the selected piece image URI so that it switches and points to the inverted version of the image/sprite. And it is able to switch back and forth between the standard variant of the piece and the inverted variant of the piece.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedAudioFileException - If audio file is not supported, throw this exception.
      IOException - If audio file is missing, throw this exception.

    • handleKeyPressDeselect

      public void handleKeyPressDeselect()
      This event handler attaches to the key press event set by the previous scene's controller: TrafficSimulatorController. If the "F" key is pressed, this will deselect the piece, by setting currentPieceSelected variable to null and displaying this to the user appropriately, by disabling any effects upon the slots of the PieceSelection that indicate that a piece was selected via method resetSlotSelection();

    • setMuteSounds

      public void setMuteSounds(Boolean bool)
      This method mutes and un-mutes sound by accepting a boolean value and re-assigning muteSounds to that value.
      Parameters:
      bool - True or False value. True to mute sounds, false to un-mute sounds.

    • getMuteSounds

      public boolean getMuteSounds()
      This method returns the value of muteSounds.
      Returns:
      Boolean value of muteSounds variable.

    • incrementPieceCounter

      public void incrementPieceCounter()
      This method increments the piece counter, the total number of added pieces currently in the scenario

    • getPieceCounterValue

      public int getPieceCounterValue()
      This method retrieves the value of piece counter variable, total number of added pieces in the scenario.
      Returns:
      Integer value representing the total number of ADDED pieces in the scenario.

    • setCurrentScene

      public void setCurrentScene(Scene scene)
      This method sets the current scene to a passed in scene instance.
      Parameters:
      scene - The scene that should be set as the current scene.

    • getCurrentScene

      public Scene getCurrentScene()
      This method gets the current scene.
      Returns:
      The current scene instance.

    • debugDisplayNodeLocation

      public void debugDisplayNodeLocation(GraphNode n, Color c)
      This is a debug method to check the location of each graphnode and to ensure it is mapped to the correct location within each road piece (or destination piece). It places circles that act as 'markers'.
      Parameters:
      n - GraphNode of type N (graphnodes contain x and y coordinates)
      c - Colour of the circle/marker

    • debugDisplayAllNodesLocation

      public void debugDisplayAllNodesLocation()
      This is a debug method that creates circles (or markers) at every GraphNode in the scenario in order to check their position. This has become redundant and was later implemented as an official feature "Display All Nodes" as a menu bar item.
